intro: Acinodendron confertum, commonly known as the dense-fruited acinodendron, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
